verses.text: 約拿從魚腹中向耶和華他的 神禱告，

words.note: Refers to the God, often capitalized with a space for reverence.

verses.heading: Jonah Prays

verses.text: 說：「我從患難中求告耶和華，他就應允我；我從陰間的深府呼求，你就垂聽我的聲音。

words.note: Implies listening with condescension or attentiveness.

verses.text: 你把我投入深海，在海洋的深處，大水環繞我；你的洪濤、你的波浪，都漫過我。

words.note: Often used in poetic or biblical contexts.

verses.text: 我說：『我雖從你眼前被趕逐，我仍要仰望你的聖殿。』

words.note: Often implies spiritual longing or expectation.

verses.text: 眾水包圍我，幾乎置我於死地；深淵環繞我；海草纏裹我的頭。

words.note: Poetic or theological term for great waters.

verses.text: 我下沉直到山麓，大地的門閂把我永遠關閉；耶和華我的 神啊！你卻把我的性命從坑中拉上來。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
Often functions as a locative suffix with prepositions.

verses.text: 當我心靈疲弱時，我就思念耶和華；我的禱告直達你面前，進入你的聖殿。

words.note: Used with 當...時 to form a temporal clause.
Can also be a verb 'to pray'.

verses.text: 那敬奉虛妄之偶像的人，實在是離棄了憐愛他們的 神（「憐愛他們的 神」原文作「他們的恩典」）。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for idols.
Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
A key theological term meaning 'unmerited favor'.

verses.text: 至於我，我要帶著感謝的聲音向你獻祭；我所許的願，我必償還。救恩是屬於耶和華的。」

words.note: Creates a nominalized clause, e.g., 'what I promised'.

verses.text: 於是耶和華吩咐那魚，魚就把約拿吐在陸地上。

words.note: Functions as a locative suffix for '陸地'.
